wordpressPost.title: Employee Engagement Weekly News Roundup: 12/12/2014
wordpressPost.content:
The WeSpire Weekly News Roundup aggregates the top articles from around the industry so that you can stay up-to-date on the state of employee engagement in CSR and sustainability on the go.

Why Social Responsibility Needs to be More Than Just a Fad

The social role of business has risen to mainstream popularity, to the point where some may say it has even become a fad, which risks the possibility of it fading. Yet, unlike most fads, the author argues that positive business is here to stay, explaining how social responsibility may be the most important management concept.

On Companies’ Holiday Wish List: Board Involvement in Sustainability Efforts

New research identifies a big gap between board of directors and their organization’s sustainability engagement programs. While 87% of respondents found boards should play a strong role in sustainability efforts, only 42% responded that their boards were currently engaged. Our favorite quote of the week: you cannot do business on a dead planet…The future of the corporation will be corporate leaders who have the guts to do what is needed.

6 Simple But Highly Effective Ways to Boost Employee Engagement

Recognizing that engaging and motivating employees is a top priority for any business leader, we love this simple how-to for getting started. No matter how engaged your employees are, these six essential steps serve as a great reminder, or starting point, for any organization to improve employee engagement.

Beyond Cost Savings, How The Cloud Transforms Business

Going from disruptive to pervasive, the cloud has emerged as a way for companies to achieve a sustainable competitive advantage, from saving money to transforming how business operates both internally and externally. Further, key resources like mobile, social, big data, and analytics make cloud-based computing a go-to for businesses.

Report: Executives Expecting Increased Resources for CSR

Good news for Corporate Social Responsibility! For the first time in over ten years, executives anticipate resources for corporate citizenship to increase over the next three years, finds a new report by the Boston College Center for Corporate Citizenship. Why the change? This important report also finds executives confirming that corporate citizenship helps them achieve their strategic goals and improve performance.
